entries.title: Soaring Death Toll Gives Grim Insight Into Russian Tactics
entries.description: Moscow is sending poorly trained recruits, including convicts, to the front lines in eastern Ukraine to pave the way for more seasoned fighters, U.S. and allied officials say.

entries.title: U.S. Says Russian Olympians Should Only Compete as Neutral Participants
entries.description: The stance differs from the full ban demanded by Ukraine and supported by some of its allies.

entries.title: Peru Official Concedes There’s No Evidence Criminals Are Behind Protests
entries.description: In an interview, Foreign Minister Ana Cecilia Gervasi acknowledged “we don’t have any evidence” that weeks of protests were being driven by criminal groups, as the country’s president has claimed.

entries.title: High-Profile Raids Showcase Zelensky’s Corruption Crackdown in Ukraine
entries.description: President Volodymyr Zelensky is eager to highlight his crackdown on corruption, ahead of E.U. accession talks and possible Western investigations of war aid.

entries.title: Your Friday Briefing: The U.S. Military Expands in the Philippines
entries.description: Also, Vladimir Putin evokes Stalingrad and a contested film is a box-office hit in India.

entries.title: Britain to Investigate if Deadliest Attack of Northern Ireland’s ‘Troubles’ Was Preventable
entries.description: The decision is a big victory for the families of the 29 people who died in the attack in August 1998, four months after the signing of the Good Friday Agreement.

entries.title: In Congo, a Pope and a Nation Revitalize One Another
entries.description: Francis has been slowed by age. But his enthusiastic welcome in Africa has proved a shot in the arm and provided a reminder of the papacy’s global reach.

entries.title: Israel’s Government Pushes Home Demolitions as Violence Surges
entries.description: Israel defends its policy of leveling the family homes of Palestinians accused of attacks on its citizens as a deterrent. Critics say it is illegal and ineffective.

entries.title: Tortured Guantánamo Detainee Is Freed in Belize
entries.description: Majid Khan, a Pakistani citizen who attended high school in Maryland, finished his sentence last year.

entries.title: A Proud Ship Turned Into a Giant Recycling Problem. Brazil Plans to Sink It.
entries.description: The old aircraft carrier, once the navy’s flagship, is packed with asbestos. No country, including Brazil, will let it dock to be dismantled.

entries.title: European Parliament Strips 2 Lawmakers of Immunity in Graft Inquiry
entries.description: The European Parliament’s move is likely to prompt the arrest of Marc Tarabella of Belgium and Andrea Cozzolino of Italy in connection with claims of influence-peddling involving Qatar and Morocco.

entries.title: Window Stickers to Prevent Bird Strikes Only Work One Way
entries.description: Every year, hundreds of millions of birds die in the United States from flying into glass. New research shows how to prevent some of those deaths.

entries.title: Encouraging Economic Signs
entries.description: New data suggests a promising possibility for the economy — that the U.S. avoids big job losses.

entries.title: Putin Expected to Use World War II Anniversary to Rally Support for War
entries.description: President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia is traveling to the city formerly known as Stalingrad, where the Soviets turned the tide of Germany’s invasion 80 years ago.

entries.title: Top E.U. Officials Arrive in Kyiv for a Summit With Zelensky
U.S. and Philippines Have a Complex Military Alliance: What to Know
entries.description: The United States and the Philippines have announced a plan to broaden American military access. The alliance is complicated by colonial history and rising tensions over Taiwan.

entries.title: A U.S. Ambassador Finds Himself on Hostile Ground in Hungary
entries.description: David Pressman, a gay human rights lawyer, has been accused by pro-government media in Hungary of undermining traditional values, violating diplomatic conventions and meddling in the judiciary.

entries.title: After Jacinda Ardern, Politics Will Never Look the Same
entries.description: For once, a politician who wasn’t afraid of fashion.

entries.title: Australia Is Removing the British Monarch From Its 5-Dollar Bill
entries.description: The plan, which includes redesigning the bank note to focus on Indigenous history, has rekindled the debate about republicanism in Australia.

entries.title: Your Thursday Briefing
entries.description: The start of a new Russian offensive.

entries.title: China and the U.S. Are Wooing Indonesia, and Beijing Has the Edge
entries.description: The resource-laden nation of nearly 300 million is a big prize in the strategic battle between the United States and China for influence in Asia.

entries.title: U.S. to Boost Military Role in the Philippines as Fears Over Taiwan Grow
entries.description: Washington and Manila announced a plan to increase American military access on four new bases in the Southeast Asian country, a strategic partner in the region.
